benchmark_details.name: InductionBench
benchmark_details.overview: InductionBench is a new benchmark designed to evaluate the inductive reasoning ability of large language models (LLMs). It tests whether LLMs can infer a string-to-string transformation from a finite set of input-output pairs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the inductive reasoning capabilities of LLMs by testing their ability to hypothesize the underlying relationship between inputs and outputs from finite examples.

data.source: Functions derived from well-defined computational classes (ISL, L-OSL, R-OSL).
data.annotation: Automated evaluation against known ground-truth functions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the comparison of predicted rules against the unique ground-truth rule set.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in reproducing the intended transformations.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using state-of-the-art LLMs across various settings of k and size of input-output pairs.
